programme.title: SEVENSECONDS, the dream of flying | Film
programme.desc: The Monsterbakken, literally the Monster Hill, is the largest ski flying hill in the world. When you sit on the take-off bar, the adrenaline level is equivalent to a panic attack and yet it is the declared goal of our two main characters to sit on this bar and plunge into the void at the first official women's ski flying event in history.

programme.title: Women's 5000 m - Speed Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 10/02/2022 at the National Speed Skating Oval. Irene Schouten (NED) claimed the Gold while Isabelle Weidemann (CAN) won Silver and Martina Sablikova (CZE) completed the podium with the Bronze.

programme.title: Men's Cross Final - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 10/02/2022 at the Genting Snow Park - P & X. Alessandro Haemmerle (AUT) claimed the Gold, Eliot Grondin (CAN) Silver and Omar Visintin (ITA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's Halfpipe Final - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 10/02/2022 at the Genting Snow Park - SS & HP. Chloe Kim (USA) dominated the scoreboard with 94.00 and claimed gold, followed by Queralt Castellet (ESP) with silver and Sena Tomita (JPN) with bronze.

programme.title: Men's Big Air Final - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 15/02/2022 at the Big Air Shougang. Yiming Su (CHN) claimed the gold medal, Mons Roisland (NOR) took home the silver and Max Parrot (CAN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's Big Air Final - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 15/02/2022 at the Big Air Shougang. Anna Gasser (AUT) claimed a gold medal, Zoi Sadowski Synnott (NZL) achieved a silver medal and Kokomo Murase (JPN) completed the podium with bronze.

programme.title: Women's & Men's PGS Finals - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 08/02/2022 at the Genting Snow Park - P & X. In the Women´s competition Ester Ledecka (CZE) claimed Gold, Daniela Ulbing (AUT) Silver and Gloria Kotnik (SLO) completed the podium. In the Men´s, Benjamin Karl (AUT) took home the Gold, Tim Mastnak (SLO) the Silver and Victor Wild (ROC) the Bronze.

programme.title: SEVENSECONDS, the dream of flying | Film
programme.desc: The Monsterbakken, literally the Monster Hill, is the largest ski flying hill in the world. When you sit on the take-off bar, the adrenaline level is equivalent to a panic attack and yet it is the declared goal of our two main characters to sit on this bar and plunge into the void at the first official women's ski flying event in history.

programme.title: Men's Large Hill Individual - Trial Round, Qualification - Ski Jumping | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 11/02/2022 at the Zhangjiakou Ski Jump Ctr. Stefan Kraft (AUT) qualified 1st in Men's Large Hill Individual Trial Round for Qualification. Marius Lindvik (NOR) qualified 1st in Men's Large Hill Individual Qualification Round. Halvor Egner Granerud (NOR) ended up 2nd in both events.

programme.title: Men's Team - Trial Round, 1st Round, Final Round - Ski Jumping | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 14/02/2022 at the Zhangjiakou Ski Jump Ctr. Austria claimed the Gold, Slovenia Silver and Germany completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's Slalom Run 1 - Alpine Skiing | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 09/02/2022 at the Nat Alpine Ski Ctr - Technical, Lena Duerr (GER) made the fastest time with 52.17, Michelle Gisin (SUI) was second with 52.20 and Sara Hector (SWE) was third with 52.29.

programme.title: The Vault: Aksel Lund Svindal, Mildred ‘Babe’ Didrikson, the evolution of bobsleigh and the magic behind Olympic ceremonies
programme.desc: We head to Norway to meet Alpine legend Aksel Lund Svindal, Norway’s “bionic man.” As Rob explores the evolution of bobsleigh, Jeannette discovers the incredible story of Sports icon Mildred ‘Babe’ Didrikson. After winning two Gold and breaking world records in LA 1932, she participated in the creation of the Ladies Professional Golf Association and won 31 events. To close the season, Jeanette meets Albertville 1992 costume designer, and the one and only Antonio Rebello who lit Barcelona 1992 cauldron with his legendary arrow.

programme.title: The Vault: Eddie the Eagle, a True Cool Running Story, Mohamed Ali and Heiden’s Golden Suit
programme.desc: Eddie Edwards donates his opening ceremony blazer to the Museum and recalls his incredible journey to becoming the Eagle of ski jumping at Calgary 1988 and a pop culture icon. Angelo restores Dudley Stokes’ goggles from the same Games while he recounts the iconic story of the Jamaican bobsleigh team. Jeannette discovers Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier’s signed gloves in The Vault. Rob discovers how Eric Heiden’s Golden suit from Lake Placid 1980 is a key moment in the evolution of the speed skating suit.

programme.title: Women's Slalom Run 2 - Alpine Skiing | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 09/02/2022 at the Nat Alpine Ski Ctr - Technical Petra Vlhova (SVK) claimed Gold with 1:44.98, Katharina Liensberger (AUT) Silver 1:45.06 while Wendy Holdener (SUI) completed the podium with 1:45.06.

programme.title: Cirque Blanc | Injury and pressure in Val d’Isère
programme.desc: As the Cirque Blanc rolls into Val d’Isère for the start of the women’s downhill ski season, the French team has one notable absentee. Romane comes to terms with a season-changing injury, and the pressure is on for Tiffany and Tessa to perform on home soil. Cirque Blanc is the Olympic Channel’s new original alpine skiing documentary series following France’s top female skiers Tessa Worley, Tiffany Gauthier and Romane Miradoli on the Alpine Ski World Cup circuit 2020/2021.

programme.title: Women's Super-G - Alpine Skiing | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 11/02/2022 at the Nat Alpine Ski Ctr - Speed. Lara Gut-Behrami (SUI) was the fastest skier in the Women’s Alpine Super-G claiming the gold medal with a time of 1:13.51. Mirjam Puchner (AUT) nabbed the silver after finishing in a time of 1:13.73 and Michelle Gisin (SUI) scooped bronze with a time of 1:13.81.

programme.title: Men’s Halfpipe Final | PyeongChang 2018 | Great Winter Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive a fantastic Freestyle Skiing halfpipe final as part of the greatest Winter Olympic Moments from the PyeongChang Winter Olympic Games in 2018 and watch David Wise winning gold for the USA, followed by Alex Ferreira with silver for the USA and Nico Porteous with bronze for New Zealand.

programme.title: Men's Snowboard Halfpipe | Torino 2006 | Great Winter Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive one of the greatest Winter Olympic Moments from the Torino Winter Olympic Games in 2006 and watch as Shaun White wins gold for the USA, Daniel Kass claims silver for the USA, and Markku Koski wins bronze for Finland in the men's Snowboard Halfpipe competition.

programme.title: Women's Snowboard Halfpipe | PyeongChang 2018 | Great Winter Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive Chloe Kim´s gold for USA. The American teenager wins the women's snowboard halfpipe gold medal at Pyeongchang's Phoenix Snow Park on 12 February, with a near-perfect score of 98.25 on her final run. Liu Jiayu wins Siver for China and Arielle Gold, bronze for USA

programme.title: Women's Halfpipe Final - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 10/02/2022 at the Genting Snow Park - SS & HP. Chloe Kim (USA) dominated the scoreboard with 94.00 and claimed gold, followed by Queralt Castellet (ESP) with silver and Sena Tomita (JPN) with bronze.

programme.title: Men's Halfpipe Final - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 11/02/2022 at the Genting Snow Park - SS & HP. Ayumu Hirano (JPN) claimed Gold while Scotty James (AUS) the Silver and Jan Scherrer (SUI) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's Slopestyle Final - Snowboard | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 07/02/2022 at the Genting Snow Park - SS & HP. Max Parrot (CAN) claimed the Gold, Yiming Su (CHN) Silver and Mark McMorris (CAN) completed the Men's Snowboard Slopestyle podium.

programme.title: Picabo | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: A charismatic tour-de-force, American Picabo Street took the alpine skiing world by storm in the 1990’s by winning Olympic silver and gold. But beneath the bravado and success lay a turbulent and complicated home life. Co-directed by Frank Marshall and Lindsey Vonn.

programme.title: Men's Team - Trial Round, 1st Round, Final Round - Ski Jumping | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 14/02/2022 at the Zhangjiakou Ski Jump Ctr. Austria claimed the Gold, Slovenia Silver and Germany completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's Slalom Run 1 - Alpine Skiing | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 16/02/2022 at the Nat Alpine Ski Ctr - Technical. Johannes Strolz (AUT) had the best finished in the first run with a time of 53.92.

programme.title: Men's Slalom Run 2 - Alpine Skiing | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 16/02/2022 at the Nat Alpine Ski Ctr - Technical. Clement Noel (FRA) claimed the Gold, Johannes Strolz (AUT) the Silver and Sebastian Foss-Solevaag (NOR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Into the Unknown
programme.desc: Into the Unknown follows the world’s top ski mountaineers including Oriol Cardona, Alba De Silvestro, Marianne Fatton and Thibault Anselmet as they chase one of their most crucial goals: qualifying for the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina 2026. Set against the dramatic Arctic landscapes of Tromsø, the documentary captures one of the final and most decisive events of the qualification season. Battling darkness, brutal weather and unforgiving terrain, the athletes push their bodies and minds to the edge while navigating the pressure of earning their Olympic spot. Through intimate moments, raw emotion, and the intense beauty of Norway’s mountains, the film reveals the true cost of ambition in a sport where every climb is a test of character and courage.

programme.title: The Vault: Gabriella Papadakis, the Luge Egg Helmet, a Superhero Outfit and the Clash of Carmens
programme.desc: We meet Gabriella Papadakis, one of the world’s top ice dancers, who donates her Gold winning skates from Beijing 2022. She talks highs and lows and her new experience with same sex ice dancing. Jeanette discovers a superhero outfit which belongs to Ester Ledecka, the only woman to win two Gold Medals in two different events at the same Olympics. As Rob researches Sports helmet evolution, Jeanette unveils some of the most iconic Figure skating costumes including from the Legendary Katarina Witt at Calgary 1988.

programme.title: The Vault: Martin Fourcade, Vuarnet’s metal skis, Football & Lost Events at the Olympics
programme.desc: Martin Fourcade, France’s most decorated Olympian, joins The Vault to share his Olympic odyssey. Jeanette hears about Jean Vuarnet’s revolutionary metal skis and the breakthrough egg position he brought to the Sport. While Rob is given the full story of the Olympic football tournament and the success of the Uruguay football team, Jeanette hears from Anne-Cecile about the unique win of David Wise in Freeski Halfpipe despite faulty bindings.

programme.title: The Vault: Ski-cross champion Fanny Smith, Paris 2024 iconic surfing picture and Olympic box office 'White Rock’
programme.desc: World champion and two-time medallist Fanny Smith visits The Vault to share her Olympic journey. Along the way, we uncover some of the most iconic pictures of the Games - including Jerome Brouillet’s shot of Gabriel Medina in Teahupo’o at Paris 2024. As Rob pays a very special visit to the Olympic films vault at La Cinémathèque Suisse and screens ‘White Rock’ from Innsbruck 1976, Jeanette discovers the story behind the last lap bell and where Curling stones are made.

programme.title: Men's Super-G - Alpine Skiing | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 08/02/2022 at the Nat Alpine Ski Ctr - Speed Matthias Mayer (AUT) claimed historic Gold, Ryan Cochran-Siegle (USA) Silver and Aleksander Kilde (NOR) completed the podium.
